name: python_psynth
tagline: The official Python library for programmatically generating graphs in Psymphonic Psynth.
body:
## python_psynth
python_psynth is the official python package for generating graphs in Psymphonic Psynth.

### Quickstart
```
# Create a Graph.
g = pyPsynth.create_graph(
    name='my graph',
    url='https://psynth.psymphonic.com/',
    username='me@company.com',
    key='myapikey'
)

# Add 10 Nodes
for i in range(0,10):
    n = psynth.Node(name='Node '+str(i))
    g.add_node(n)
ns = g.node_list()

# Add 30 random Links.
lt = psynth.LinkType()
g.add_link_type(lt)
for i in range(1,30):
    origin = randint(0, len(ns)-1)
    terminus = randint(0, len(ns)-1)
    while terminus == origin:
        terminus = randint(0, len(ns)-1)
    link = psynth.Link(ns[origin].uid, ns[terminus].uid, lt.name, value=randint(1, lt.max))
    g.add_link(link)

# Add 3 Details to each Node.
for node in ns:
    for i in range(0, 3):
        d = psynth.Detail("http://psymphonic.com", type='link')
        node.add_detail(d)

# Add 3 Details to each Link.
for link in g.link_list():
    for i in range(0, 3):
        d = psynth.Detail("http://psymphonic.com", type='link')
        link.add_detail(d)

# Calculate a layout for the Graph.
g.draw()
```

### Documentation
Check out the [docs](annotated.html)

### Authors and Contributors
This package is created and maintained by Psymphonic Inc.
